Understate: The claim may understate the impact of the budget cuts by only focusing on the percentage of school districts receiving less funding per pupil.
Lack enough support: The claim relies on a projection from the Legislative Budget Board, which may not provide enough evidence to fully support the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the funding disparities, such as changes in student enrollment or changes in property values.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in its argument by not acknowledging that fewer districts were expected to receive less aid per student in fiscal year 2017 compared to 2011.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the budget cuts in 2011 were the sole cause of the funding disparities, without considering other factors that may have influenced funding levels.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact of the budget cuts by not providing a comprehensive analysis of the funding situation in all school districts.
Contradict fact: No contradictory biases were found in the provided information.
